str2: Therefore, then. Apparently a primary word; certainly, or accordingly.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To know beforehand, foreknow. From pro and ginosko; to know beforehand, i.e. Foresee.

parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
str2: Probably from phule through the idea of isolation; to watch, i.e. Be on guard; by implication, to preserve, obey, avoid.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From sun and apago; to take off together, i.e. Transport with.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Feminine of planos; objectively, fraudulence; subjectively, a straying from orthodoxy or piety.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lawless, unrestrained, licentious. Lawless, i.e. criminal.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
str2: From ek and pipto; to drop away; specially, be driven out of one's course; figuratively, to lose, become inefficient.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
